headerDisplay: Homebridge plugin for TP-Link TAPO security cameras.
footerDisplay: If your video feed is not working, try to check if any of the parameters at the video config can be tuned. You can use https://sunoo.github.io/homebridge-camera-ffmpeg/configs to check if someone has already found the right values for your camera.

name.title: Name
name.description: Set the camera name for display in the Home app

username.title: TAPO username
username.description: Most of the time you should leave this empty, defaulting to admin. If it doesn't work, try to use your streaming username (see below)

password.title: TAPO password
password.description: Password of your TAPO Cloud (the one you use to login the application, not the password for the RTSP configuration). If it doesn't work, try to use your streaming password (see below)

streamUser.title: Stream User
streamUser.description: Username to access the RTSP video feed (You can find them in TAPO app > Settings > Advanced Settings > Camera Account) - Note: This must be only alphanumeric [A-Za-z0-9], no special characters allowed!

streamPassword.title: Stream Password
streamPassword.description: Password to access the RTSP video feed (You can find them in TAPO app > Settings > Advanced Settings > Camera Account) - Note: This must be only alphanumeric [A-Za-z0-9], no special characters allowed!

pullInterval.title: Pull Interval
pullInterval.description: Numbers of milliseconds after we update accessories by polling the status of the camera

debug.title: Debug
debug.description: Enables debugging of the underlying camera-ffmpeg plugin

disableEyesToggleAccessory.title: Disable Eyes toggle
disableEyesToggleAccessory.description: Disables the eyes (privacy mode) switch accessory

disableMotionDetectionToggleAccessory.title: Disable Motion Detection toggle
disableMotionDetectionToggleAccessory.description: Disables the Motion Detection switch accessory

lowQuality.title: Low Quality
lowQuality.description: Video stream will be requested in low-quality instead of high-quality

motionDetectionToggleAccessoryName.title: Motion Detection toggle Name
motionDetectionToggleAccessoryName.description: Name of the Motion Detection toggle

videoMaxWidth.title: Video Max Width
videoMaxWidth.description: Maximum width of the video stream

videoMaxHeight.title: Video Max Height
videoMaxHeight.description: Maximum height of the video stream

videoMaxFPS.title: Video Max FPS
videoMaxFPS.description: Maximum frames per second of the video stream

videoMaxBitrate.title: Video Max Bitrate
videoMaxBitrate.description: Maximum bitrate of the video stream

videoForceMax.title: Force Max Video
videoForceMax.description: Force the video stream to use the maximum values, instead of the one provided by the Homekit request. Most likely you don't want this
